climbs.name: Zen Spasm
climbs.fa: Eric Zschiesche in the 80s wearing EBs

content.description: Start on obvious right facing hold about head height. Make a couple wide moves right across the face, until you can work your way under the roof. Grab an undercling, and make a Big reach out the roof to an edge. Top out high.
content.protection: Tall. Multiple pads and spotters are very nice.
content.location: On the right side of the Corridor when facing away from Moores Wall. Starts in the middle of the orange face.

content.description: Sit start on a decent hold and lock in a good heel hook. Slap up the arete to the horn, work feet, and top out in the mouth of the wide crack.
content.protection: One pad is good, more if you don't feel like scooting it.
content.location: In the Corridor to the left of 5.9 and Zen Spasm. Left of the wide, left slanting crack.

content.description: Sit start on two sloping crimps and make a big move up to a large hold. Keep working up the face to the horizontal crack, slap for the top and prepare for a committing top out.
content.location: To the right of Duck Soup.

content.description: Start at a well-chalked start hold a few feet left of "Rocky Road". Make your way to the fingerlock via a high right gaston, matchable undercling and possibly some crimps for the shorties. A high right foot will get you to the horizontal crack up and right. Trend left on jugs and handjams, exit at the weakness above Zen Spasm.
content.location: Uphill side of the Zschiesche corridor, below the obvious finger slot

content.description: Start on obvious jug. Dyno straight up (slightly right) to good ledge below the lip, matel over top
content.protection: Pad for the boulder beside you is nice
content.location: Across from the Masterlock boulder, the back corner of the corridor area.

content.description: Start on the jug and move up through small crimps and a sidepull to hit the jug below the lip. A v4 eliminate dynos fro the start jug to the jug below the lip. Do not fall on this dyno.
content.protection: A pad or two to cover a rock under you, and maybe a spotter on the rock to the right
content.location: In the back left corner of the Corridor. Walk along the trail straight until you come to where two  boulders meet and scramble over this to enter the corridor(or walk around the larger boulder on the left). Boone lounge will be on your right as you enter
